intro: Milligania longifolia, commonly known as the slender milkweed, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers that are followed by follicles containing seeds with silky hairs. It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions. Milligania longifolia is also noted for its milky sap, which is a common feature among plants in its family.
